definitions.definition: A fabric or structure of fibrous elements attached to each other at regular intervals.

definitions.example: A network of roads crisscrossed the country.

definitions.definition: A directory of people maintained for their advancement
definitions.example: To get a job in today's economy, it is important to have a strong network.

definitions.definition: A group of affiliated television stations that broadcast common programs from a parent company.
Multiple computers and other devices connected together to share information
definitions.example: The copy machine is connected to the network so it can now serve as a printer.

definitions.definition: To interact socially for the purpose of getting connections or personal advancement.
definitions.example: Many people find it worthwhile to network for jobs and information.

definitions.definition: To connect two or more computers or other computerized devices.
definitions.example: If we network his machine to the server, he will be able to see all the files.

definitions.definition: To interconnect a group or system.
To broadcast across an entire network of stations and affiliates at the same time.
